image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: Tasracing fails in its bid to keep Ben Yole banned from harness racing in the state, as an appeals board overturns a ban for the second time.

title.children: Racing appeals board scratches ban on Tasmania's lead harness racing trainer, Ben Yole, yet again

image.altText: Rufus Black gesturing during interview.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's public education system has a lot of problems, and they seem to be getting worse with just over half of students finishing year 12. The state's only university is urging the government to find solutions now, before it's too late.

title.children: Tasmania's public education system is 'in trouble'. The state's only university says schools have to change

image.altText: Louise Goode shouts as her former house is demolished behind her.

props.synopsis: Louise Goode's fight for the place of "emotional comfort" she called home lasted a quarter of a century, until it was demolished in front of her as she screamed for help.

title.children: 'Stop, please!': The moment a demolition crew ended an Australian's 25-year fight for her home

image.altText: A man photographed anonymously in his house, who uses ketamine

props.synopsis: The illegal use of ketamine reached a record high in 2023 in Australia. But as ketamine rises in popularity, so too do new chemical cousins of the drug — and their long-term side effects are "an unknown, unknown".

title.children: Ketamine is a 'twilight anaesthetic', and its use is at a record high

props.synopsis: The search for British TV doctor Michael Mosley is ramping up after he went missing in Greece. Here's what we know about the circumstances surrounding his disappearance so far.

title.children: A rocky trail and a phone left behind: Here's what we know about the disappearance of TV doctor Michael Mosley

image.altText: A fluffy bird (light mantled albatross chick) in a nest with water and large rock formations in the background.

props.synopsis: Justine Thompson has investigated crooks and crashes on Sydney's beat, but on remote Macquarie Island, halfway to Antarctica, she had 50-knot winds, orcas, major refuelling operations and people to manage.

title.children: From the Sydney police beat to a remote subantarctic outpost, station leader Justine returns from 'Jurassic Park'

image.altText: two people are looking at each other, a man is standing at a bar smiling, the woman is sitting, smiling and pointing at him.

props.synopsis: Scottish woman Fiona Harvey is seeking $255 million in damages saying she is the real-life inspiration behind the character Martha portrayed in the hit limited Netflix series Baby Reindeer.

title.children: Netflix to defend multi-million dollar lawsuit filed by Fiona Harvey over Baby Reindeer

image.altText: A man with a beard and headset mic smiles

props.synopsis: The Kimberley astronomer who rose to national and international prominence on ABC and BBC outer space specials has died, aged 62.

title.children: Astronomer, stargazer and tour guide Greg 'Space Gandalf' Quicke dies

image.altText: A woman in her early 40s - the artist Laura Jones - smiling and standing in front of her painting of Tim Winton

props.synopsis: Laura Jones has won the 2024 Archibald Prize for her portrait of Tim Winton.

title.children: Laura Jones wins $100,000 Archibald Prize for portrait of author Tim Winton

image.altText: A tall gold building with a smaller building with a white roof in front of it

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has ordered the operators of Adelaide’s Casino to pay $67 million, in a money laundering case brought on by financial crimes agency AUSTRAC.

title.children: Adelaide casino fined $67m over money laundering case

image.altText: A pink pig, backlit, looks straight on at the camera, which is zoomed in on its face.

props.synopsis: The average American farmer doesn't fix fences and drive tractors. Thanks to market concentration, there is now a handful of companies that dominate the US food system, and they are impacting Australia too.

title.children: Meet the six mega-rich families running the food system

image.altText: Andrew Giles in his office.

props.synopsis: The immigration minister has issued a new directive he says will make it "clearer" that non-citizens with a history of family or sexual violence should be deported, even if they have lived most of their lives in Australia.

title.children: Andrew Giles issues replacement to 'direction 99' which he says prioritises community safety

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: New legislation will make it harder for people charged with serious domestic violence offences to get bail. The move has been welcomed by friends of Molly Ticehurst, who was allegedly murdered earlier this year.

title.children: Electronic monitoring devices will be mandatory under new bail laws inspired by Molly Ticehurst's death

image.altText: First-person perspective from man lying on the ground with a man in a suit looming over him.

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting a journalist at Canberra Airport after The Australian posted footage that appears to show Mr Costello walking towards reporter Liam Mendes, who was asking him questions, before Mr Mendes falls backwards.

title.children: Nine chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting journalist at Canberra Airport

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Sua'ali'i is pointed off the field

props.synopsis: After being sent off in his State of Origin debut, Joseph Sua'ali'i chooses not to challenge the suspension offered for his high tackle on Reece Walsh.

title.children: Sua'ali'i accepts four-match ban for Origin high shot on Walsh

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says his cabinet is preparing "an offer" to put to the Australian people at the election. As it crafts its pitch, the biggest uncertainty is what sort of parliament a second term Labor government would likely face.

title.children: A minority government or President Trump: Uncertainty looms over Labor's promises to voters

image.altText: Former retail worker Hannah sits on the beach

props.synopsis: Retail workers are told "the customer is always right" but when they're dealing with leering, stalking and intrusive questions, a new study has found there are few places to turn for support.

title.children: From the awkward to the 'really scary', sexual harassment is 'just another day in retail' for staff, according to study

image.altText: Four European Union flags fly outside a large tall corporate building on a dark and stormy day.

props.synopsis: The European Central Bank cut interest rates for the first time in five years after its inflation outlook improved, but warned that it's not "pre-committing to a particular rate path" for future decisions. Follow live.

title.children: European Central Bank joins Canada in cutting interest rates, but not 'pre-committing' to further moves

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Small businesses apparently resilient in the face of a stalling economy
ASX pushing higher at lunch as gold miners lead gains
SkyCity fined $67 million for breaching anti-money laundering laws

image.altText: King Charles reaches out from under a black umbrella canopy to wave at a crowd.

props.synopsis: The King's Birthday celebrations are happening this weekend. Here's a state-by-state breakdown of when you'll get a day off.

title.children: Millions of Australians have an extra day off next week. But it depends on where you live

image.altText: Three firefighters look up at a blackened shop front and damaged awnings with fire hoses lying on the road behind them.

props.synopsis: Firefighters fear it's only a matter of time before someone is hurt as tobacco arson attacks continue in Melbourne.

title.children: Two more Melbourne tobacco shops targeted in organised crime turf war

image.altText: A young girl with a bald head smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A world-first Australian study finds personalised cancer treatments using genome sequencing are achieving remission in cases considered unlikely to be cured.

title.children: Personalised treatments offer new hope for incurable childhood cancers for kids like Ka'ili

image.altText: Two SES team members in flood waters

props.synopsis: The NSW State Emergency Service has carried out around 50 flood rescues overnight as parts of the Illawarra and Sydney were drenched with more than 200 millimetres of rain.

title.children: 'Copped an absolute flogging': Dozens of rescues as Sydney, Illawarra smashed by heavy rain

image.altText: A woman and a man holding a toddler in front of a playground

props.synopsis: The family live in Wagga Wagga with their 14-month-old son but are still waiting for a partner visa to be approved.

title.children: Australian mum pleads for compassion as fiance stranded in Bangkok after trying to qualify for Olympics

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks at a podium in front of American flags.

props.synopsis: Two things Donald Trump loves to talk about are America's border crisis and Joe Biden's son. Both are now making news in the US, just days after the former president's criminal conviction dominated the headlines.

title.children: Biden tries to flip the political narrative, as his family deals with a personal drama

image.altText: Marlinja Community

props.synopsis: An Indigenous-owned solar farm, the first to be connected to a power grid, has been opened in the Northern Territory remote community of Marlinja.

title.children: How this remote Indigenous community has reduced every resident's power bill by 70 per cent

image.altText: F1 reserve driver Jack Doohan during the launch of the Alpine F1 car, wearing a racing suit with no helmet

props.synopsis: Alpine has called up Australian racing driver Jack Doohan to complete the first practice session this weekend in Montréal.

title.children: Son of Aussie racing legend gets first audition for vacant F1 seat

image.altText: Punnets of blueberries for sale

props.synopsis: The price of blueberries has soared around the nation, and strawberry prices look set to follow.

title.children: Blueberry prices surge, but would you spend $20 on a punnet?

image.altText: A boy looks amid grey rubble

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says Hamas militants were operating from within the Nuseirat school, while witnesses recount chaotic scenes as the injured are rushed to nearby hospitals.

title.children: Israeli strike kills at least 40 people at Gaza school that military claims was being used by Hamas

image.altText: White, yellow and red curly fungi.

props.synopsis: Fungi enthusiasts in SA's South East say there's a lot of interest in this year's season, despite recent cases of suspected mushroom poisonings.

title.children: As late fungi season blooms in mushroom 'paradise', foragers are urged to be wary

image.altText: A row of tents in front of a long building at the Australian National University campus.

props.synopsis: ANU vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell tells a Senate estimates hearing that two students connected to pro-Palestinian protests on campus have been expelled, and are among 10 disciplinary actions launched since the protest began.

title.children: Disciplinary action taken against 10 students since ANU pro-Palestine encampment began, Senate estimates hears

image.altText: Chris, aged 3, smiles for a photo, wearing a cap backwards.

props.synopsis: The prevalence of inflammatory bowel disease in Australia is rising, particularly in children. Some families are struggling to get a diagnosis and appropriate treatment.

title.children: A doctor said he’d ‘eat his shoe' if Sarah’s toddler Chris had IBD. He was proved wrong

image.altText: Socceroos

props.synopsis: Socceroos coach Graham Arnold hits out at the "dangerous" pitch as Australia defeats Bangladesh 2-0 in a World Cup qualifier.

title.children: 'It's unacceptable': Arnold blasts dangerous pitch as Socceroos see off Bangladesh in World Cup qualifier

image.altText: Jasmine Paolini

props.synopsis: Jasmine Paolini sees off Russian teen Mirra Andreeva to book a spot in the women's French Open final against Iga Swiatek.

title.children: 'It seems impossible': Italian bolter secures unlikely French Open final spot against rampaging Swiatek

image.altText: Wil Anderson, a 50-year-old man with grey hair pushed back, performs live on stage, his arms folded..

props.synopsis: Rhys Nicholson, Cameron James, Geraldine Quinn, Wil Anderson and Nath Valvo unpack why Australian comedy is making an unexpected turn towards the earnest.

title.children: Comedians are suddenly celebrating the people they care deeply about in their shows. This is why
